At last the car ride comes to a stop, and you are once again sent screaming and running as the cacophonous junk in Tiffany's purse acts like Steve seeking missiles, finding a way to fly at you from everywhere at once, forcing you to dodge it all. With another jerking motion the purse is pulled skyward and Tiffany's things stop trying to kill you. At last you are able to look outside and you find that Tiffany has returned to...
1212122111212111111111.title: Destination?

choices: keep going. No place is safe at this size
get some sleep. You are at least safer on the table than you would be on the flo
12121221112121111111112.content:
Looking out of the purse you are disappointed to find that instead of the lights of downtown you are bathed in the lights of Tiffany's porch. You had hoped that she would go to her office and advise them that you weren't home, but instead she must have chosen to call it and night and returned to her own place. Not really that surprising considering that it was now well past midnight, or at least you thought it was.

With a rattling noise you hear Tiffany examine her keys, and try at least two different ones before she at last finds the one that goes to her front door. A sliding click issues from the lock and she smiles in triumph. You are smiling with her for a second, until quite suddenly the lights above dim, and you see the keys poised right over you. With a start you hide behind a compact as the metal blades fall from the sky, leaving a scratch in the plastic shield you chose, and showing that it could have easily cut you in half.

Breathing a sigh of relief you climb out from behind your protection just in time to be thrown into pure darkness. Outside a porch light had been on so she could see her way to the door, but Tiffany had already shutdown all the inside house lights, and with no bulbs shining overhead the purse was blacker than coal. In way you find the darkness comforting, as you are no longer able to see all those everyday items that are no potentially deadly to you. Still your comfort is rattled a bit when you are suddenly, and quite roughly, thrown through the air.

"DAMN IT," you hear Tiffany swear as the purse clunks onto the table, you trying desperately to regain your feet inside. Not knowing about your struggles Tiffany listens to the dead silence around her, and then lets out breathe as she hears nothing other than her own heart. Thinking it was nice to be home after such a wasted night Tiffany then proceeds to walk away, and with the purse still tipped on its side you are able to watch as she walks down a small hallway, and out of sight.

Looking after her you can't really tell which is stronger, your fear at being alone completely now at this small size, or your relief that she was no longer around so that she wouldn't unknowingly kill, maim, or in some way do you harm. Cautiously you begin to climb over the ruin that was the inside of Tiffany's purse before the rough landing. With a great effort you are able to make your way over the junk and at last emerge into open air once more, and you get your first glance at Tiffany's apartment.

The place seems awfully large, or so you think. Some of it might be attributed to your lower point of view, but even so you are forced to assume that Tiffany does not live alone. Looking around you drink in your surroundings. You assume from the twin towers across the vast brown plain that you are on the dining table, as you can see white and black rocks held within them through there clear surfaces, which glint in the light shining in from the window behind the table in the closest wall.

Other than the window there is nothing on the walls worth noting, as they are the simple whitewashed, clean cut affairs you find in most apartments and homes these days. Finding nothing more interesting on the walls you begin to look towards the exits of the room which you assume is the dining room for Tiffany's apartment.

The hallway which Tiffany walked down is set at an angle to the table, so you can't see down it at all, but the sounds of running water, and gurgling, followed by a spit makes you conclude that the bathroom is located somewhere beyond its depths. A quick series of footsteps can be heard after the bathroom, and her light tread makes you think that you were indeed right, Tiffany does not live alone, and is trying not to awaken the people that live with her.

The exit to the dining room on the opposite side is at a good angle to you, and you are able to stare directly into it, and you curse the architects. Looking into the room beyond you are instantly sure that it is the kitchen, and more than that it reminds you that you yourself haven't eaten since three that afternoon. You had intended on talking a little with Tiffany before doing what you two did, and maybe grabbing a bite to eat with her before she grabbed a bite of you. Sadly Tiffany had been all business tonight, and so you hadn't gotten a chance.

Trying you best to ignore the rumbling within your stomach you look to the third and final exit to the dining room, and though the angle is not so great, you think you can just make out the arm of a sofa in the other room. You assume that it is the living room of the apartment, as you are about ninety percent certain that it was the same room Tiffany had passed through before sending you hurtling onto the hardwood surface on which you now stand.

With you inspection of the immediate area complete you are again faced with a choice, though this one much less cut and dry than the others you'd been faced with recently. You energy had been sapped by the events of tonight, and you had gotten almost no sleep the night before, which added together to make you very tired. Though adrenalin was coursing through your veins at breakneck speeds making you feel as though you could go all night without a wink, you are forced to concede that you might collapse on your feet after too much longer.

The choice, simple as it seems, was whether or not to try and sleep here on the table, where you were at least relatively safe, or try to keep going, and get off the table and get yourself either some food or attention, either one being a good thing in your situation. Gazing at a clock in the kitchen, a glowing digital one rather than your own analog set over your TV, a fact you are thankful for, you can see the time is just a shade under one A.M. Looking around you decide to...
12121221112121111111112.title: Tiffany's Apartment, the view from the table

choices: a barking dog, a big one
121212211121211111111122.content:
Looking out over the darkened scene before you, you search for somewhere soft to bed down for the night. Tomorrow is going to be a big day for you, and hopefully by the end of it you'll be able to measure up to your usual standards, but for tonight you decide that you adventures at this size are over. Your visual search of the premises give you little to be happy about, but after a time you discover an unused napkin near the salt and pepper shakers.

Walking over to the shakers takes a while, and makes you begin to appreciate just how small you are. Gazing at a loose grain of salt you pick it up. To your current perspective the little white dot is now a large cube like rock. Not too large, just like something you'd find in a drive way, but considering that you are normally able to hold hundreds, if not thousands of these little pebbles in your hand you begin to feel worried. Picking up as many as you can you find that only about twenty of them fill up one hand at your current size.

Tossing a few of the pebbles as far as you can you pop one into your mouth. It's not really food, and in fact is dehydrating you even as you suck on it, but your stomach at least stops its complaints about its empty state for the moment, and you continue your stroll over to the napkins. Stepping up to one of the huge white sheets is like stepping up to a circus tent stomped flat, an image that burns itself into you mind, despite your attempts to banish it back from whence it came.

Pulling at the corner of the cloth you find that its weight if far to great for you to pull anywhere, and trying to rip it is like trying to rip through a phone book. After a few minutes you give up, and the plan you had absently been forming about spelling out a message with the napkins is abandoned. Instead you push at the top, and find that, though heavy, the napkin is still soft enough on both top and bottom to serve as a bed and sheet for you tonight.

Just as you are climbing into the napkins to fall asleep you feel a sudden building of pressure in you abdomen, and search around desperately for a bathroom, before the details of your situation intrude again and you realize that they don't make toilets in you size. Faced with another decision you are quick to run for the edge of the table. After all, crapping on the place where Tiffany eats might seem more than a little rude.

Running as fast as you can you make a much better time getting to the edge of the table, and within a minute you are standing at it, looking down at the tiles floor far below. Now at the edge you are dumbfounded about how to proceed. You now how to pee safely, but the crapping is beyond you for a moment until you decide to just take down your pants and lean over the edge. Doing just that you do your best to keep the steady stream of yellow pointed backwards, while still forcing out the brownies.

A few minutes later you are happily relieved, and pretty sure that Tiffany will not see the little puddle or mound far below. Thinking about that you are pleased at first, but it slowly dawns on you that she's not likely to see you either. What little joy you still had evaporating quickly you take almost four times as long to get back to the napkin which you still plan on using for a bed. Climbing up its surface you pul yourself in between its folds, and then, with a final drooping you eyelids close like lead shutters and you are sent off to the land of dreams.

Your dreams are filled with almost the exact same images as your last one, the one you had waiting for Tiffany to arrive at your home. This time though instead of happily waiting in her sandwich for her to eat you, you are screaming your lungs out at her not to do it, and she, unhearing, just keeps munching away. As her teeth suddenly find you, your whole world becomes light. Jolting up you realize that you were awakened by someone turning on the lights, and then you hear the sound of...
121212211121211111111122.title: The night at Tiffany's

choices: Scream as loud as you tiny lungs can manage
1212122111212111111111221.content:
Covering you ears you stare at where the noise of the barking dog came from, and watch as Tiffany enters the dining room, a furry companion at her back. The dog is a magnificent specimen. If he'd been on a show circuit you're sure he would have at least a dozen blue ribbons by now, though the apartment doesn't really look big enough to house a monster like him.

He was a German Shepard, probably at least part wolf by the size of him, though in truth the size is probably a little out of perspective for someone like you. Other than his size he seems to be pure Shepard as far as you can tell. His gray and black coat shines softly in the artificial lights over head, and his brown eyes seems like limped pools ready to spill out of his oversized head.

The only really odd physical feature are the eyebrows, which is the only real word you can think of for the tufts of bushy white hair over his eyes. The things look awfully out of place on the dog, but you've never been that big a fan of dog breds or their peculiarities. It might be a normal feature for certain dogs of his bred, and you like the expressiveness they give his face. Almost as if he were human.

"COME ON RONALD. I HAVE TO GO TO WORK EARLY TODAY. BRYAN PROBABLY WANTS A REPORT ABOUT THAT MAN LAST NIGHT WHO WASN'T IN HIS HOME. I'M SURE AARON WILL WANT TO HEAR ABOUT IT TOO, AFTER ALL IF HIS TAG MALFUNCTIONED AGAIN THEN THE FOUNDER WILL HAVE HIS ASS, WON'T HE?" she asks the dog, who barks in response.

You are a bit worried that you were right about the dog's gender without ever really knowing how you guessed it, but you assumed the dog was male simply because of its size, a bad assumption considering your current stature isn't much taller than a flat napkin now, but you seem to have gotten lucky this time in your guessing, and you don't see any problem with that.

"Tiffany, down here!" you shout as you wave your arms at her. You really don't expect her to hear you, and you are right she walks by the table without sparing a second glance. Ronald too doesn't care to investigate the sound, though his ears perk a bit at hearing something that he couldn't identify. He doesn't stop moving to investigate farther, and continues after Tiffany as she enters the kitchen.

"Well now what genius?" you ask yourself, hoping in some, already mad part of your brain that some omnipotent creature might hear the question and answer. That mad part even imagines the voice answering in a booming voice, but the rest of your mind tells that part to go stand in a corner as you try and think of another plan, as the jumping and screaming is not working.

So absorbed are you in your thoughts that you don't hear the clatter as food is poured into a dish, or Tiffany complain that the current jug is empty. Looking around she finds the next jug of dried food, but then finds herself unable to open the dog proof cap, a necessity since Ronald had proven himself quite capable of getting into the regular bags of dry food.

Searching for something like a rag or a towel to give her more friction she spots the one item that you really wish she had ignored. The napkin you had climbed back into to consider your thoughts. The first you know about her discovery is the upward motion, and your sudden near fall down a few hundred feet until you grab the edge of the napkin.

"Tiffany, wait!" you scream with all your might, but find your voice is overpowered by Tiffany humming some song, and the loud panting of Ronald as he watches her walk over to the food jug to finish filling his dish. As a respecting diner Ronald will not begin eating until the dish is full, a habit that Tiffany had taught him by not filling it all the way if he started eating before it was full.

Putting the napkin over the lid of the jug she turned with all her might, forcing the lid to bend to her mighty will, which had won her two Star Tech, Battle Champion trophies, which were proudly displayed on her entertainment unit in her living room. The jug, no match for her like most opponents, at last gave under her grip, and began to turn.

You, luckily, were not crushed under her grip, though you came very close as one of her fingers sat right next to you as she turned the lid. Satisfied at her victory Tiffany unscrewed the lid the rest of the way, and then lightly set it aside, dragging the napkin right over the open mouth of the jug. You unfortunately, feel as your feet catch on the lip of the jug's mouth, and then feel the napkin slip through your grip before you go tumbling in among the brown, red, and amber boulders that smell awful.

Knowing you are in a perilous situation by the sight of the dog through the clear plastic wall, you begin to run for the edge, over the bits of dry food which are only slightly larger than yourself. You are almost at the wall when suddenly the whole world erupts in chaos as Tiffany lifts the jug, and you are buried instantly in a swaying avalanche of dog food.

Before you can even react to the motion, however, it all reverses direction, and instead of the dull thunk of the dog food bits hitting each other, you hear the clink as the bits hit the metal bowl. Screaming an incomprehensible babble you begin to try an old cartoon trick, jumping from boulder to boulder, trying to keep your upward momentum high enough to cancel out gravity.

Surprisingly, you find this little trick works, and for a moment you are convinced you might be safe, but then out of nowhere a stray chunk hits you in the chest, sending you and it tumbling downward into the pile below. Falling in among the bits you try and force your way up, but are soon buried under the food, not even light reaching you because you are so far down in the bowl.

As suddenly as everything began, all noise ends, and you are reminded of the T-Rex scene from Jurassic Park, where everything is still and quiet as the booming of its footsteps slowly come closer, making water ripple. You find that the booming footsteps of the humongous Ronald are not nearly that slow, and you hear the distant, yet all too close sound of crunching dog food.

Looking around you are thrown about as the food shifts, and sometimes allowing in shafts of light, and of course the sound of the dog munching at his breakfast. Your mind comes up once again with two paths for you at this point. The first seems the sanest, and it is to try and climb out of the bowl of food before the dog ends up with a live meal. The other is to try and scream for help from Tiffany, or failing that, tell the dog to stop, and hope it obeys commands in English, even if they're coming from inside his food dish.
1212122111212111111111221.title: Dog Troubles

choices: Stay, after all he wouldn't eat you now that Tiff's seen you, would he?
What are you, nuts? Run like hell!
12121221112121111111112212.content:
Considering the fact that the little pebbles of dog food are bigger than you, though not by much, and are constantly shifting as Ronald takes huge bites from the mound of dry kibble, and then either crunches it for a while or just swallows and goes back for more, you decide to scream. The climbing probably wouldn't work, and who knows, maybe the dog won't eat all his food and climbing will just get you eaten when you wouldn't have been otherwise.

"Tiffany! Help! Ronald's going to eat me!!!" you shout as loud as you can manage, stumbling slightly at the dog's name as you mind finally begins to link the name with the animal. Ronald seems an odd name for a dog to you, though you haven't owned one for years so it might be in the vouge right now to give dogs human sounding names, but you doubt it. Maybe Tiffany just likes to give her pets more humanistic names, you think, and then are surprised to realize that the munching sound has stopped.

Above you Ronald heard an odd noise emanating from his usually quiet breakfast. What's more that noise sounded like a human voice trying to tell Tiff that it's about to be eaten by her dog, him. Ronald, his face expressing wonder almost as well as any humans thanks to the what tufts over his gray face, begins to dig through the food with his snout, at last uncovering a small creature sitting atop one of the pieces of kibble.

"UH, TIFF? I THINK WE HAVE A PROBLEM," says Ronald in perfect English, with a slight southern accent. You, happy at being uncovered without being forced down the dog's gullet take a moment to register who spoke, and when it at last hits your stressed out, and most likely insane mind that the dog just spoke, you are surprised your chin doesn't hit the floor considering that you're not that far off it.

"WHAT IS IT RONALD?" asks Tiffany as she walks into your view. You're still focused on the dog though, and barely register her entrance into your world, which consists of an upward view out of a dog food bowl.

"WELL THERE SEEMS TO BE A MAN IN MY FOOD THIS MORNING, AND HE WANTS TO TALK TO YOU BEFORE I EAT HIM," responds Ronald, point his snout down at you. Tiffany blinks away the last bit of sleep out f her eyes and then reaches out of your view for a moment, her hand returning with a pair of glasses which she slips on with a graceful ease. By this point you have realized that a talking dog is probably not that unusual considering that you are staring at him from an angle inside his food dish standing only slightly shorter than the food around you.

"WELL SO THERE IS!" comments Tiffany as she gazes down at you, quite loudly to your tiny ears, forcing you to again cover them with your hands as the ringing slowly subsides. By the time you are able to look up again Tiffany is already carefully reaching into the pile of dog food, and grips the piece you are sitting on between her finger and thumb. Waiting as you reposition yourself she gently pulls the piece out of the bowl, and you pass right in front of Ronald's mouth, seeing in a panoramic view the moist cavern you are almost shoved into. Before either you are Tiffany can say anything Ronald puts his forepaws on the counter where she places your little kibble and then stares at you hungrily.

"IS THERE ANYONE ELSE IN MY FOOD?" he asks you.

"Not as far as I know," you respond after a moment of thought. After all, just because you didn't see anyone doesn't mean they weren't there. Ronald, hearing this quickly goes back to his food dish and stares into it, moving pieces about with his snout, and then pulling back.

"IF THERE IS ANYONE ELSE IN THERE PLEASE SPEAK UP NOW OR GET A ONE WAY PASS TO MY STOMACH," Ronald says into the dish, and then puts his ear right up against it. You and Tiffany wait for a moment staring at the big dog, who in truth probably weighs more than you do when your normal sized. The waiting is ended when Ronald nods his head pulling it away, and then attacks the dry food like a wolf attacking a deer.

With the occasional crunch sound punctuating the air, a sound you are very happy you are not a part of, you turn back to Tiffany, who is still wearing those glasses. Now that you are closer to them you see that they have in odd knob just below the left eye, and that as Tiffany fiddles with it her eyes seem to get bigger or smaller depending on the direction. After playing with them for a while she must find the setting she wanted, as she nods at you.

"WELL HELLO THERE MR. MARSHALL. I'D SAY YOU HAD AN INTERESTING NIGHT," she says down at you, and there are so many things you want to shout back at her, some of them good, some of them bad, and some of them just plain mean, but you control yourself. After all just because she can't hear you, doesn't mean Ronald can't. Despite the fact that he's still chowing down you can see at least one ear turned your way.

Saying nothing, you just stare up at her for a while before she suddenly jumps, finally realizing that she never gave you the communicator last night, or at least not the last night that she remembers. Getting up she moves out of the kitchen, leaving you alone with the huge dog who licks his chops. Looking towards him you can see he's cleaned out his bowl, and is in fact looking towards the kibble piece you are sitting on.

Realizing quickly that he wants to eat your current place of residence, you climb off onto the counter. Ronald, seeing this, gets up on the counter again and then lolls his tongue out in a very doglike way, panting a bit he moves his tongue over the counter towards the kibble bit, and you. Do you stay near the bit and hope he can control his tongue well enough not to lap you up with the kibble piece, or move away quickly?
12121221112121111111112212.title: Speak Ronald

choices: Tiffany returns with the mini-transmitter and finds you gone
Ronald walks off and goes to do something else
121212211121211111111122121.content:
Ronald's tongue coasts along the counter moving toward the last piece of kibble and you. He zig-zags his tongue along the way, perhaps stalling to give you one last time to get away but you stand your ground. He wouldn't eat you now, after all, Tiffany had already seen you and(sort of) communicated with you. Apparently all this means nothing to his conscience as he scoops up the piece of food and yourself with his tongue. Your vision turns upside-down and blurs before going dark as you enter his mouth. It doesn't take much time after you enter his hot, moist mouth before he lurches his tongue up against the roof of his mouth and pushes you back toward his gullet. His throat grabs a hold of you and pulls you in with powerful muscles down into the squishy, wet tube of his throat. You are pushed and pulled down from his mouth, through his neck and into his main body within a minute before you are plopped into the pile of food he just ate shortly before you.

You scramble to the top of the pile and huddle up, knees to face while you contemplate what you've gotten yourself into. Everything seemed to be going so nicely when you got Tiffany's attention, she was surely going to help you! But then you had to go get yourself eaten by her pet dog...thing. All you can do is sit and wait for your inevitable demise inside the belly of a dog...thing.
121212211121211111111122121.title: Apparently he would eat you

121212211121211111111122122.content:
Discretion is the better part of valor, at least in your opinion, so you move away from the piece of kibble as the dog, or whatever Ronald is, lap up the boulder that's still slightly bigger than you and swallow it whole with an audible gulp. Licking his chops again he looks down at you with the those all too human eyes, a hungry glint in the back of them. For a moment you're positive that he's going to gulp you down too, but then with a wuff he pushes off the counter and walks out of the kitchen.

Breathing a sigh of relief you sit down and wait for Tiffany to return. It isn't more than a few seconds before you hear the booming impacts of her feet, and then see her titanic form enter the kitchen, holding two items. The first you recognize as the communicator you used last night, but the second you can't place at first. It is a vial that contains a liquid you can't identify, and after a moment of study you come to realize that it must be the antidote to the shrinking formula.

Walking up to the counter Tiffany looks down at you, still wearing those glasses from before. With a small gesture she brushes her hand against the side of the lenses and her eyes suddenly grow even bigger as the lenses seem to contract. Looking straight down at you she pushes a button on the communicator and two pieces fall off, one is the smaller walkie talkie you dropped and smashed the night before, while the other is a much larger earpiece which Tiffany sticks in her own ear before putting the walkie talkie down next to you.

"WELL MR. MARSHALL, WOULD YOU LIKE TO TELL ME HOW YOU ENDED UP IN RONALD'S FOOD NOW, OR DO YOU WANT TO GROW BACK FIRST?" she asks you, holding the vial of antidote in her hand. Looking up at her you know she's just trying to mess with you, and so you hold down the side button and speak into your end of the communicator.

"Tiffany, I most defiantly want to have this conversation on an eye to eye level, so if you wouldn't mind could you please pass that vial down to me?," you tell, her and she smiles wickedly down at you, and then stares in an offhand way at the vial in her hand. She starts to do some odd tricks with t, including spinning it on the tip of her finger so that it's standing up, and then tossing it into the air and catching it just before it hits the ground with what you think would have been enough force to shatter it.

Seeing your agitation at that trick seems to be enough for Tiffany and she places the vial on the counter next to you. Grinning in relief you run over to the towering vial, which is probably only an inch or two tall but is many times your height, you then begin to search for a way to access the contents, and quickly find a small valve on the side of the vial, situated just above a faucet like spigot. Looking forward you see another valve and spigot, and another is behind you, all set at different sizes.

Silently thanking whoever designed the vial you walk up to the valve set at about your size and begin to turn it. Inside you hear a grinding sound as the panel inside the vial slides out of place, allowing the black syrupy liquid within to begin flowing out. Sticking your head under the spigot you get a big mouthful of the foul tasting stuff and gulp it down despite your natural urge to spit it out. Closing the valve again you step back and wait. The shrinking formula worked immediately, so the antidote should word just as fast, if it works at all, you think darkly.
121212211121211111111122122.title: Tiffany returns with the communicator and more

choices: INVOLVED IN AN INCIDENT," he says glumly
A LAB SPECIMEN," he tells you proudly.
1212122111212111111111221221.content:
You are standing on that counter with Tiffany gazing down at you with those glasses on her face for several minutes before she sighs in defeat, and you look up at her desperately.

"Well that's antidotes a bust," you tell her through the walkie talkie, and she nods.

"STRANGE TOO. USUALLY ANTIDOTES FROM STAR TECH WORK. IT'S STUFF LIKE THE SHRINKING POTION THAT DOES BAD THINGS TO YOU," she says picking up the vial and gazing into it, as f trying to will it into working. Then, with a dismissing gesture she shoves the vial back into the hip pack and pulls out the needle that she used to transport you last night to the burger joint.

"WELL SINCE THE ANTIDOTE DIDN'T WORK WE'LL HAVE TO SEE BRYAN BOUT GETTING YOU FIXED," she says, placing the needle beside you. Staring up at her you know what she says is right, but you can't help but feel that know might be the only time to ask her some questions that have been bugging you for a while, like the fact that her dog talks.

"So we'll be going back to the MA office downtown?" you ask, just trying to start a conversation with the titaness before you.

"YES. YOU'RE LUCKY THAT HIS OFFICE IS IN THAT BUILDING RATHER THAN STAR TECH HEADQUARTERS, CAUSE I'M NOT SURE HOW I'D GET YOU IN THERE SAFELY," she says offhandedly as she reaches high over your head and pulls out a bowl. Obviously finding a miniaturized man in her talking dog's food hasn't killed her appetite as she reaches for a box of what looks like cornflakes to you as they fall into the bowl, but with a Star Tech logo on the side of the box you're not completely sure they're not some kind of Soylent product.

"SO TELL ME, HOW DID YOU END UP IN RONALD'S FOOD DISH?" she asks as she pours milk over her bowl and then grabs a spoon and walks over to the table. Obviously she doesn't want to risk injuring you in any way as she leaves you in the kitchen, far from her and her food,

"Well after a very interesting experience with you at a local diner, I appeared back at my house, but something must have been wrong with the Tag cause I was still small when I reappeared still very small, though not quite as small as I was before. I should have known something was wrong when it smoked after I used it," you comment into the communicator. Looking over at Tiffany you can see her shovel a spoonful of cereal into her mouth and then swallow it whole before she turns back towards you.

"WHAT DID THE SMOKE SMELL LIKE?" she asks you from her seat, her voice still booming despite the distance.

"I didn't really take the time to sniff it cause you came to my door a moment later, but if I remember right I think it smelled kinda like, well like Ozone I guess," you tell her, not really sure what else to say as you aren't really sure what it smelled like, but you've heard descriptions of Ozone and they seemed to fit. Looking into the dining room of her apartment you can she her lift the spoon up to her mouth and play with it a moment before turning back towards you.

"NO. THAT'S WHAT IT'S SUPPOSED TO SMELL LIKE. THE ELECTRICAL CHARGE IONIZES THE AIR AND CAUSES THE OZONE SMELL. SO THE TAG WORKED RIGHT. I WONDER WHAT ELSE IT COULD HAVE BEEN. OH WELL, KEEP GOING WITH YOUR STORY. HOW DID YOU GET FROM YOUR APARTMENT TO RONALD'S BREAKFAST," she says lifting another spoonful of cereal into her mouth.

"Where was I?" you say to your self, tapping the antenna of the communicator on you chin as you think, and then you remember and bring the speaker to you lips as you press down the button.

"After I appeared on my sofa I didn't have to wait long before some booming noises indicated that you were once again at my door. I didn't have any real way of making contact so I just waited on my couch, hoping you would come in on your own when you found the door was unlocked," you tell her, and she seems to cringe back a little bit from the table as you tell her that. Obviously she thinks she should feel bad about entering an unoccupied house, but you decide to alleviate some of her guilt.

"That was lucky for me or I might never have been found. After you threw your purse almost right next to me I climbed in. A very bumpy, and nearly deadly car ride later we arrived here at your place, where I climbed out to find myself on your table. I decided to get some sleep myself after that drive. You and Ronald woke me up coming in, and when you used the napkin I was sleeping in to open a jug of dry food I fell. Then instead of climbing out myself I decided to try and cry out for some help. Which your talking dog supplied. By the way, why do have a talking dog?" you ask her as nonchalantly as possible.

"I AM NOT A DOG AND TIFFANY DOES NOT OWN ME, BUG BOY," comes a voice from the floor that causes you to jump in surprise. Looking over the counter's edge you find that Ronald came back into the kitchen and is now sitting right below you.

"Well if you aren't a dog then what are you?" you shout down at Ronald. Tiffany, even though she can't hear what you ask, obviously knew you were going to ask it as she responds.

"RONALD IS ONE OF MANY BEINGS UNDER MY CARE MISTER MARSHALL. BESIDES MY ROLE AS A COMPANION FOR THE MA OFFICE I ALSO DO OTHER THINGS FOR MY FATHER. INCLUDING TAKING CARE OF SOME OF THOSE UNFORTUNATE ONES THAT COME OUT OF HIS LABS," she tells you, her eyes going from the counter where you are, to Ronald on the floor, and then back to her breakfast.

"So somebody screwed up with you too, huh?" you ask Ronald.

"NO ONE ‘SCREWED UP' WITH ME, BUG BOY. I WAS...
1212122111212111111111221221.title: Antidote fails, but some answers are gained

choices: The MA logo(An MA that seems to shrink and grow as you watch)
The Star Tech logo(A five pointed star with teardrop shape around it, pointed en
12121221112121111111112212211.content:
(Ronald first appeared in an Interactive titled the Technicolor, which has since been deleted. In it the reader was given a device that could alter humans, either changing them into animals or changing their sizes.)

"An incident?" you say to him questioningly.

"I WAS A TESTER FOR SOME EQUIPMENT THAT A MAN NAMED AARON MADE BEFORE HE BECAME AN EMPLOYEE OF STAR TECH. HE'S THE SAME GUY WHO INVENTED THE TACHYON TAG YOU USED LAST NIGHT FOR YOUR WEIRD LITTLE FANTASY," he spits at you with venom in his voice. You're a little hurt and embarrassed but Ronald doesn't seem to care and continues on.

"ANYWAY THE EQUIPMENT WORKED AT FIRST, BUT THANKS TO A POWER SURGE IT BLEW AND I GOT STUCK LIKE THIS. THAT INCIDENT GOT AARON TO GO TO STAR TECH WHERE THEY GAVE ME THE ABILITY TO SPEAK ENGLISH, BUT THEY'RE STILL WORKING ON A WAY TO MAKE ME HUMAN AGAIN, OR AT LEAST THEY SAY THEY A....OW!" his cry of pain attracts you interest, and you notice for the first time that Tiffany has gotten up from the table and is standing on his tail.

"NOW RONALD, YOU KNOW NOT TO INSULT OUR GUESTS LIKE THAT, OR DADDY AND HIS COMPANY, RIGHT?" the last part she says sweetly, lifting Ronald's face to stare up at her own as she steps off his tail. The look in her eyes would probably make you shiver if you were normal size, at less than an inch tall though it makes you want to find another napkin to hide in.

"OH COME OFF IT TIFF. THAT MAN ISN'T ANY MORE YOU FATHER THAN THE FACTORY IS THE FATHER OF A CAR. TO HIM YOU'RE JUST AN ARTIFACT. NOTHING MORE NOTHING LESS," Ronald tells her, and then before she can do anything to him the dog, which claims to be a transformed human takes off. Tiffany seems ready to dart off after him before she stops, remembering for the first time that you're on the counter behind her. Turning she faces you and you decide to ask her point blank about what Ronald just said.

"Is what the dog said true? Are you some kind of artifact?" you ask her through the communicator. You remember a scientific conference a few years back determined that creating a fully artificial human was impossible, but then so was shrinking someone to less than an inch tall.

"I PREFER THAT YOU CALL ME AN AP OR ARTIFICIAL PERSON. AND YES IT'S TRUE. DADDY DABBLED IN GENETIC RESEARCH A FEW YEARS BACK AND...WELL I AM THE END RESULT. I HAVE MY OWN LIFE THOUGH, AND A BIRTH CERTIFICATE AND EVERYTHING. THE ONLY DIFFERENCE BETWEEN ME AND MOST PEOPLE IS THE FACT THAT MY BIRTHPLACE IS SOMEWHERE IN A LAB, AND THAT MY GENETIC STRUCTURE IS SUPPOSED TO BE THE OPTIMUM FOR A HUMAN," she tells you, and you can't help but hear a note of pride in her voice.

"What do you mean optimum?" you ask her after wrapping you brain around the fact that the woman you're talking to isn't a normal person. Then again the talking dog and the shrinking should have warned you to the fact that Tiffany probably isn't normal herself. Instead of answering your latest inquiry outright Tiffany walks over to a nearby cabinet and begins to rummage through it. You hear various clanking sounds, and at least one noise that sounds like a knife biting into wood.

After a few minutes a triumphant ‘YES!' can be heard from the cabinet and Tiffany emerges with what looks like a mallet in her left hand. The large hammer resembles similar hammers that you've seen in the old cartoons with a long handle attached to a head almost as big as your's. Well your normal head. Before you can even begin to guess how many yous would fit inside the head of the mallet currently Tiffany places her hand next to you on the counter and then brings the mallet down with tremendous force, enough to send you flying.

When you finally skid to a stop about a foot, or several yards depending on how you look at it, from where you had been sitting, you look over to she Tiffany smiling down at you as she plays with the mallet in one hand and moves her other hand in various ways to show it still works correctly. Nodding your head you look over and your jaw drops. The place where she'd smacked her hand now has a depression on it in the shape of her palm in the inch think wood, yet you can see her hand is completely unharmed.

"Ouch," is all you can say as you push the button to speak with Tiffany again, and she starts laughing immediately, relieving at least some of the tension in the kitchen. Ronald chooses this moment to saunter back into the kitchen and takes several gulps of water before walking off again, apparently, throughly unimpressed by Tiffany's antics. The woman herself takes this moment to fuss with her hair a bit looking after the dog before turning back to you.

"SO SHALL WE BE ON OUR WAY THEN?" she asks, and before you can reply she picks up the needle and pulls back on the plunger. Somehow the needle knows you are it's intended passenger, and expands just enough to allow you entrance before you are again suspended in the center of its glassy confines. Tiffany doesn't even ask if you are ok before shoving the needle into her purse and setting off for the MA office.

You are not completely sure how much time you spend in her purse during this latest outing, though you believe to be somewhere between the first time to the burger joint which took only a few minutes, and the second trip to her house which seemed to take hours, but was probably only about half an hour, if that. Whatever the case, Tiffany at last withdraws the needle from her purse and you are blinded by the light that floods into you glass encased world. When at last the spots clear from your eyes you look around and quickly find you are in Tiffany's palm at an office building. The logo on the side of the wall is...
12121221112121111111112212211.title: Ronald is human, Tiffany though...

choices: Go to Aaron, after all he invented the Tag
Get the Founder to help, he is higher up in the company after all
121212211121211111111122122111.content:
(Bryan Smith first appears in an interactive by Speck called Special Delivery and is also about Macrophilia. If you don't get this, it is his shrinking potion which was used to make you small. Here's a link to Special Delivery: http://www.writing.com/main/interact/ite...

The logo of the MA main office is still slightly creepy as you watch it shrink down in size before your eyes. For a moment you find yourself again wondering if it is some kind of holographic trick, or if it really is shrinking, a feat you thought impossible only a few short hours ago when you stepped through the double doors that are still swinging from Tiffany's entrance.

Averting your eyes from the disturbing logo you look towards Tiffany, who is currently engaged in pointing at you while displaying you for the middle aged woman who works the counter at MA. You remember her from last night, and have a fleeting thought that maybe she is like Tiffany, some kind of artificial person, but you decide it is probably rude to ask, and besides Tiffany apparently didn't bring the communicator, so you can't hear her response anyway.

Waiting it out you can feel you face flush slightly as Tiffany continues to point at you and the woman working the counter stares from her seat before falling out of you view behind her desk. You imagine that she's furiously typing on a keyboard or talking to someone, and you are quite wrong. All she's really doing is pushing a button that causes a seemingly whole section of wall to yawn open, allowing you and Tiffany inside. It'll be for those through the door to get worked up about your situation.

Inside the needle your head is sent reeling at the sharp contrast between the inner workings of the MA office and its public image. Outside the formally hidden door the MA office looks like just that, an office building, though for a decidedly odd form of business. Inside the hidden door things are quite different as you can see rooms that can't be real and must be some form of hologram, and antromorphic creatures, including a wolf woman who stands on humanlike legs, but whose hands look like claws, and her face is more animal than human with a long snout and jaws that could probably bite through metal.

You notice the wolf woman specifically because Tiffany stops for a moment to chat with her, and you are again put on display as the titaness points you out to her friend, who then proceeds to sniff at the needle, though if she can smell you or not you don't know. As she pulls up you are treated to a view of her mouth, and are once again finding reason to thank you tailors at making a form fitting outfit for you as you're sure normal pants would rip apart at this point.

Bringing your ‘little friend' under control you look up and she Tiffany is smiling at everyone that you two pass in the halls, waving with her free hand. She doesn't seem to be as friendly with the others as she does with the wolf woman as she doesn't stop to show you off to anyone else, instead entering the office at the end of the hallway that appears o be the central thoroughfare for all employees at the MA building.

The office is not what one would call lavishly furnished, though it is certainly not bare. The walls, which outside look like something off Star Trek, are made to appear to be wooden inside the office. The floor underfoot is as immaculate as the floor in the hallway, probably more so, and is done in a tile motif that really sets off the wooden walls. Everywhere on the walls you can see various monitors, though instead of showing security cameras inside the building they are tuned into various TV stations and movies.

Ignoring the sudden change in scenery once again Tiffany strolls up to the desk in the center of the room, and before you can react you once again find yourself falling towards the needle's point, which has again expand to allow you egress from the glass tube. You landings have yet to be soft at this size, though falling atop the letterhead is probably the best landing you've had yet, as you only feel like you've broken one rib as you get back on your feet.

"MR. SMITH I REALLY NEED TO TALK TO YOU," you hear Tiffany say, which is a comforting counter point to the silence that permeated the inside of the needle. The next sound you hear reminds you of a door whoosh off the old Star Trek series with Kirk and Spock. The whooshing sound was apparently the result of a man turning his chair to face you.

The man was middle aged, and his face was lined with concern. In his left hand he holds a load of papers he had apparently been going over when you and Tiffany entered his office. With his right hand he reaches up and pulls off his glasses before tossing the papers on to his desk dismissing them for the moment and rubbing his nose with his now free left hand. You are nearly blown away as the papers slam onto the desk almost right next to you but manage to keep you seat as the man speaks.

"YES TIFFANY, HOW MAY I HELP YOU TODAY?" he asks her. Instead of answering Tiffany points at you, and the man, Mr. Bryan Smith by the placard on his desk, looks confused for a moment before catching her drift. Looking down at you he slips back on his glasses and plays with an almost invisible wheel under the left lens that makes his eyes grow. Bryan, at last catching good sight of you leans back in his chair and sighs.

"LET ME GUESS. THIS IS THE RED LIGHT THAT MRS. GREEN FLASHED BACK A FEW MINUTES AGO?" he asks her while staring down at you.

"YES. SOMETHING HAPPENED LAST NIGHT AND HE GOT INTO MY PURSE AND FOLLOWED ME HOME. AFTER NEARLY GETTING EATEN BY RONALD HE GOT NOTICED AND I GAVE HIM THE ANTIDOTE, WHICH, AS YOU CAN SEE DID NOT WORK," she tells him, gesturing at you.

"THAT'S ODD. THE ANTIDOTE WORKED ON EVERYONE ELSE," he says quizzically while pointing at you. His glasses emit a low beeping sound, and in the right lens you see an outline of you body flash on the lens before a small line moves from your head to your feet and then back again. Another series of beeps later have Mr. Smith gripping his chin in frustration.

"I SEE THE PROBLEM, BUT I DON'T KNOW WHAT TO DO ABOUT IT MY DEAR," he tells Tiffany, talking like you weren't even in the room. You fight the urge to shout at him as Tiffany asks the question you would very much like the answer to.

"WHAT IS WRONG WITH HIM THEN?" she asks.

"QUITE SIMPLY THAT THE ANTIDOTE WILL NOT AFFECT SOMEONE WHO IT DOESN'T RECOGNIZE AS BEING SHRUNKEN, AND I CAN'T FIND A DROP OF MY FORMULA INSIDE THE LITTLE MAN. I'M GUESSING AARON'S TAG IS ONCE AGAIN TO BLAME FOR A HEADACHE," he tells her, and you remember Ronald's comment about someone named Aaron having invented the Tachyon Tags. Right then you really wish you'd asked where you could find this man, as you'd really like to sock him in the chin.

"I GUESS YOU CAN'T HELP US THEN, CAN YOU?" she asks Mr. Smith, and he shakes his head glumly.

"WELL THEN WHAT AM I SUPPOSED TO DO?" she asks him, a note of desperation in her voice. You wonder why she's so concerned about you, but then she probably feels at least somewhat responsible for your current circumstances.

"AS I SEE IT YOU HAVE TO CHOICES. GO TO AARON AND ASK HIM TO SORT ALL THIS OUT, A RISKY PROPOSITION AT BEST AS MY DEAR COUSIN SEEMS TO LOSE MOST OF HIS PATIENTS LATELY, OR YOU CAN GO TO THE FOUNDER AND GET HIS HELP, AN EVEN RISKIER PROPOSITION, THOUGH USUALLY NOT A DEADLY RISK SINCE YOUR FATHER DOESN'T GET PEOPLE KILLED, HE JUST ENDS UP LOSING THEM IN TIME OR SOMETHING SIMILAR," Bryan tells her, before picking up the papers he tossed down before and swivelling his chair so that the back again faces you.

Looking down at you with concern written all over her face you can tell that Tiffany wants to know who you wish to go to. Obviously you want to go to Aaron to give the jerk a piece of your mind, but you also would like to get better to, and if Aaron's solution to you problem works half as well as his Tag then you're libel to wind up dead or worse. The Founder of Star Technologies, and Tiffany's ‘Father' might be the way to go, though you're not sure you really want to meet the man responsible for some of the horrors they've shown on the late news that come out of Star Tech labs all over the world.
121212211121211111111122122111.title: Meet Bryan Smith, President of MA

choices: Hold off, it might actually be safer to eat at Star Tech HQ anyway
1212122111212111111111221221112.content:
With a sigh you at last come to a decision, though not one you like, or can really agree with. If you had any other choice you'd probably take that instead, but of the two guys you can go to for help with your ‘little' problem, you think Tiffany's father, the Founder of Star Technologies, might be able to help. According to the news he is the smartest man alive, and the designer of some cutting edge stuff. If anyone has something to induce growth, it would probably be him.

"Let's go see you dad Tiff, at least then I can lodge my complaints to someone who has the authority to kick Aaron's ass," you tell her, and she nods in agreement. You expect her to pull out the needle again, which she does. Pressing the button on the side causes the needle to expand again, and within moments you are safely locked away inside a glass prison which doesn't let even sound in. The ride this time is not as boring, as Tiffany carries the needle in her hand as she strolls through the building and back outside.

As before you are amazed at the various people and rooms along the corridors of the hidden portion of the MA office. Anthros, both lizard and furry, human, and even some that look like androids are walking the halls, some stopping to chat, or so you believe from the way they look. Being unable hear anything in side the tube it is entirely possible that these people are discussing serious business matters, but the way some of them break out in laughter seems to indicate otherwise.

Tiffany is again all smiles as she walks through this secret world, and most of the people are glad to return the smile, as Tiffany really is one of them, a product of Star Tech and its founder. You've heard the reports and crackpots on late night talk shows discussing some of the things that come out of the Star Tech labs, and you really wonder how big those same crackpots would flip if they could see that even their insane ravings don't cover half of all of the strangeness that goes on inside.

And this is just a subsidiary, a small branch office. Not even a lab. It makes you think that if this is what they present to the public, well the public that signs non-disclosure agreements anyway, then what do they have at their main labs. Gateways to Hell, hand held planet busters, and probably at least one unfilmed Mel Brooks script. All of these could be there, and probably some things you just can't even imagine.

Your head is again sent spinning as you step out of the inner MA office to the same place where this madness began. Despite the perspective things in the office are still recognizable to you, and you are looking through the distortion of the needle at a seat you had thought was too small last night, and is now several times larger than you. One phrase goes through your mind at this point, though it seems highly melodramatic. ‘Oh how the mighty have fallen.'

The view is great, at least compared to the inside of Tiffany's purse, and this time as you walk outside you are greeted by the light of the sun, the first direct sunlight you've seen since you got shrunk, and despite the fact that you can see a fly that is slightly bigger than you are, it is still a great sight. All around you are the sights of city life, without any of the noise, and high above you is a beautiful woman, who is really not a woman, but you don't really care either.

"So where are we going anyway, Tiff?" you ask her through the communicator. Looking down at you she tries to say something, but then obviously remembers that the needle is soundproof. Sighing she walks over to her car and gets inside. Setting the needle down in her lap she leans over the seat and pulls her end of the communicator out of the hip pack again.

"We're going to the Star Tech Headquarters, of course. You're lucky that Aaron wanted to keep MA close to home so that HQ could keep tabs on it, as we only have about a three hour drive between here and there," she responds. You don't really agree that 3 hours is close, but it's still closer than you would have expected. Still an unexpected problem has arisen that you decide to inform Tiffany about now that your able to.

"Uh Tiff we do have a slight problem," you tell her.

"And what's that?" she asks, starting her car and backing out of the space where she was parked.

"Well I haven't eaten since about 10:00 PM last night, and I think I might starve to death in three hours. Any chance of getting some food?" you ask her, trying to talk over the noise of your own stomach.

"Oh, well, I guess we could stop somewhere on the way over, but you might want to wait. They have a great food court at the HQ. We can grab a bite to eat before we go see daddy," she suggests, though how she does it is a mystery to you. The communicator is set to her side, yet she can hear you and speak to you through it, something a normal walkie talkie would not allow, though considering Star Tech built it, you're pretty sure it isn't a normal walkie talkie. Still can you control your gut for three hours, or do you want to stop for food now?
