1441211.content:
The client is a tall, tower of a pain with dark hair and a very fit form. He rather rapidly explains he's done this before and knows of your first time status, hence why he's the one your seeing today. After your back pack is off, he's into it, tags himself and has the vial of shrink stuff along with a radio your only now finding out links back to one embedded in your ears. Some first guy, this would be easy.

"Ok," Mark says, "so, I like action and especially when it gets worse for the hero. I'll start out fairly large and just keep shrinking while you at first rampage and eventually just act normal once I'm on you."

Without, the guy goes from towering over you to quickly getting down to size. On all fours, you were only 2 feet, maybe 3 tall, and this guy was seven at the start. He is quickly viewing you as an elephant and then a giant as he stops at 3 inches tall, for now. or as tall as your toes. At that point he takes off and its your cue to attack like any cat would.

Your paw stretches out to bat at him, filled with impaling needles, he goes flying and you give chase, running all over the house like some cartoon of a cat and mouse. You leave dirty footprints all over as you jump on glass topped tables, formerly clean carpets and shiny floors. This guy's sole advantage over your titan form was that you held back and his little tag thing.

Every once in a while, he sneaks over to the vile of shrinking stuff, which is supposed to be taken in proportion. The last you see of the guy is after his last trip to the shrink stuff. After that he had jumped to the floor and you pounced. By the time you lift your paw up, after feeling no squirming, not even from the start, he's not there. This would seem to be the part where you go about life as usual, or at least like any cat.
1441211.title: Way little dude

144122.content:
The procedure that made you part animal was a bit on the extreme side and rest was recommended so that people could get used to their new bodies and to ensure there were no side effects while working with a client. Really it was logical as the human body was pretty much torn down, removed and rebuilt. People were clumsy like this in the first few days and it of course also had the potential side effects...

Your provided with jeans and a shirt to fit your body but no shoes, they're really not needed now. After that, you walk the halls on all fours heading outside, there is to be a car waiting for you and that will be the ride home, yet again for safety purposes. It was odd now, you felt short, yet when you stood on just two legs were taller than before... Oh well, you'd get used to it.

At the doors you walked outside and a chaufer opened a limo door for you, the executive treatment. Like a real cat, you ran forward, jumped and skidded onto the seat to stop at the other side and now like a dog, stick your head out. Tough-luck if cat's hated you for it, even as a human that'd been something you did, albeit that was just to tick off your parents in your younger years, it was now a habit. Minutes later, the car rolled on down the road.

All the way, a few odd looks came your way, but more or less you were unnoticed, probably considered a real lynx and some rich idiot's pet. A few minutes after it started, the car stopped and you were let out. Your house was right there and you ran out to it, the door being unlocked, you took a second to stand and open it, then charged inside to see your home from a cat's perspective...
144122.title: Home to rest for a while, work in a few days

1441222.content: It was late til' you'd gotten home, so your first though was bed and had followed up on it by curling up on your bed and falling asleep. The night just went in a flash and the morning was there in an instant. As you got up and looked around, you saw something immediately wrong...
1441222.title: Side Effects/Complications in the Morning...

14412221.content:
CRAP!

You look around, your blankets are an ocean of clothe! It feels like your in a gigantic hangar or something rather than your room. There's ripples of clothe and... and... STRANDS OF FUR bigger than you! This is not good! On all fours, you bolt to the side of the bed and look down an immsense drop. At less than an inch, half inch and maybe even smaller than a quarter inch tall, its at least a 70 foot drop, maybe even more.

Stopping there, you try to figure a way out of this mess...
14412221.title: Shrunken

choices: You try and get down from the bed and ignore how far the fall appears to be.
You decide to wait right where you are hoping someone shows up looking for you.
144122212.content:
You continue to look over the edge of the drop wondering how to get down, it almost seemed to to become a longer drop the longer you looked at it, at one point it had appeared 70 feet down, now a hundred, no farther. It took you a moment to realize you weren't just having a case of vertigo! The drop was becoming larger! You were still getting smaller!

An eighth of an inch and still shrinking! Even your first time shrinking that had left you larger than this!

Previously shed hairs were now large enough in width that you would have to climb on top of them individual specks of dust that were in your bed were as large as you were. It was a good thing you had already made it to the edge of the bed now, at your current size just going from one end of the bed to the other would have been a long walk. You paced back and forth nervously at the edge of your sheets looking down, having to move forward to continuously stay close to the edge. Why had you shrunken again? And why had you gotten so small?

Looking over the edge you considered making a jump for it, the fall looks to go on forever now, but at your current size it's not like you weighed anything, you wouldn't be hurt, right? That was the square cubed law or something, the bigger they are the harder they fall, so the opposite should hold true as well, should you tell yourself. You could try climbing down the sheets and to the bottom of the bed but that might take you days to climb down, and you were going to need food and water eventually.

Hopefully, your employer would send someone when they realize you were missing. Though as you were now you'd be nothing more than the tiniest speck imaginable. You could climb and sit on top of a speck of dust now at your current size. They were like boulders to you. The shrinking seemed to be slowing though, maybe that was a sign you'd at least stop shrinking. Well, if they sent someone, and they saw your empty bed and discarded clothing they could figure out they're looking for someone small, right? You could always hope you didn't get any smaller and wait for rescue, or you could try to get down and move on yourself. Of course, even if you got down from the bed once you got to the floor you'd be a sea of carpet strands that would stretch on high above you like skyscrapers.

It was time to make a decision, you couldn't fret around about this forever.
144122212.title: More shrinking..

choices: You land safely in the carpet.
1441222121.content:
Anything beats staying here, even if it seems pointless you have to try. You can't stay in bed your entire life. Somehow, you suspect this has a different meaning than when most people say it. Either way, you're getting down from here.

You carefully move over the edge of the bed, digging your claws into the sides of the sheets. They're not nearly long enough to penetrate your bed sheets, but at the very least you're able to get a decent hand hold with them and start to lower yourself down. After several minutes you realize you've barely made any progress, sure it feels like you've gone down several feet yourself, but in reality you had only made it down about an inch off the side of the bed. In the end, there really was only one way you were going to get down sometime today.

You took a deep breath, if you thought to much about what you were going to do next you'd panic, and then you wouldn't go through with it, and you'd just be stuck hanging off of this sheet for all eternity, or at least until you lost your grip, and then you'd do what you had originally planning to do anything.

You took a deep breath, and tried to reassure yourself it was only a few feet. Even if it seemed like miles upon miles, it was only a few feet. This was going to be just like skydiving, just only for a few feet, even if it was really like miles for you, and without and you were doing this without a parachute and.

You let go, if you thought about it a moment longer you were going to never go through with it. You fell from the bed, fell for what seemed like miles, and there was only one thought rushing through your head.

Wow, this was a really stupid idea.

"I IMMEDIATELY REGRET THIS DECISION!" You gave a shout as you continued to fall, still, it would be over very soon, you'd be on the ground, glorious sweet solid ground beneath your four paws and you could never ever have to think about doing anything this stupid ever again.

NEVER AGAIN!
1441222121.title: You try and get down from the bed

choices: Eventually someone comes looking for you.
You shrink even more before Monday!
1441222122.content:
Well getting down from the bed certainly sounds like a good thing, realistically you have to think about what that would mean, getting lost in an endless forest of carpet strands wasn't going to help your best bet was waiting here for now. You were supposed to be recovering for the weekend, surely when you didn't show up on Monday they would send someone looking for you realizing something had gone wrong.

Of course, that still left the weekend itself that you were stuck up here by yourself for. What were you going to do till then? You thought about it for a little bit, you were a technically a predator, though a very tiny one, you could hunt for food, but what were you going to hunt for? Well, at this point, the only thing you could really think of would be dust mites. Surviving off dust mites for an entire weekend, if nothing else it would be a completely new experience. Well, there were supposedly supposed to be plenty of dust mites in any given room, at least you wouldn't starve. Still, to survive off that, blech.

Still, you supposed it was better than starving. You turned away from the bed and swished your tiny tail on the hunt for now. There wasn't a whole lot you could do until someone showed up on Monday looking for you, you might as well hunt or something to kill time. It was going to certainly going to be long weekend.
1441222122.title: You decide to wait right where you

choices: Wave your arms, make some noise and try to be found.
Hide and try to remain undiscovered
14412221221.content:
The weekend passes and you spend it as a lynx shrunken to a size that just barely avoids being classified as microscopic. It's difficult at first, you don't exactly have the fine trained hunting senses of a real lynx, but dust mites don't seem to be that used to having big cats come after them, and so you're able to hunt and feed yourself throughout the weekend, by Sunday morning you're a pro hunter and even starting to think that you could survive even if no one does show up.

Eventually Monday comes, you wake up curled up in a ball and blink sleepily as you look around. You yawn and slowly stand up and stretch then examine your surrounding again, the same enormous continent of fabric known as your sheets covered bed. Nothing has changed from the day before. You pace a few feet as you wake up, though you realize that's probably isn't quite the right measurement anymore. What? Maybe a millimeter, if you were lucky. Either way you were preparing for the day, when you heard it, loud deafening footsteps! Though they probably weren't so much loud as you were just rather small when the sound waves hit you. Since shrinking this tiny you had thankfully never strayed to far from the edge of the bed so it didn't take you long to run there on all fours. As you reached the edge you looked out over the edge that was almost an endless abyss, there was a person in your room wearing an MA uniform, though they were unimaginably gargantuan in comparison to you. Up to now you had only interacted with inanimate objects and the tiniest of creatures, it had made you aware of how small you were, but seeing someone normal sized really drove the point home. It was like meeting someone tall enough to have their heads reach up beyond the clouds, large and powerful enough to move entire continents. A single finger taller than the tallest tree in comparison to you. It was almost intimidating to face something so daunting, they were clearly here looking for you, after all you were technically their employee and it made sense they'd be concerned when you didn't show up after your transformation. This person finding you was probably your only chance of ever getting back to your normal size.

But at the same time once they found you then you'd be completely at their mercy, you can't exactly outrun them, and they could easily pin you down with no effort using nothing more than their pinky. For a moment, you consider hiding, it'd not like they'd ever find you so small, and you could live out your life in your tiny world hunting the smallest of prey. I would certainly be a little more rough than your current life, but it was doable.

Still, you could just be paranoid, they're professionals, and surely they'd be able to help you get big again but without some help they might not even see you.
14412221221.title: Eventually someone comes looking for you.

choices: You want to try to reverse the shrinking
You're more interested in this job
144122212211.content:
At their mercy or not you decide it's better to be found and taken out of here than spend the rest of your life hunting dust mites in your own bed. You run around on the edge of the bed screaming, yowling, waving your arms and jumping up and down trying to get the man's attention. It seems hopeless, like a flea hoping to attract attention from halfway across the room.

Luckily, the man seems to be looking for you, and being rather meticulous about it. Either by luck or through his diligence he eventually finds you, peering down at you he blinks a few times as if unsure if the tiny speck on the bed is you. You shout and try to grab hid attention but he doesn't seem to hear you your voice just won't carry.

Eventually, he produces a pair of tweezers, you back up a bit nervous at this but not before he expertly snags you up lifting you into the air by your tail. He then opens a small jar and drops you inside screwing the lid shut. The jar wasn't much bigger than a jar of peanutbutter but there was plenty of room for you. You watched through the glass as he left your house and placed your jar in the passenger seat of his car as he drove you back to MA Labs.

At the labs you were eventually placed in in a small Petri dish, the edge of it being a wall impossible for you to ever climb. The techs in the lab spent some time hooking up a strange machine next to the dish and then finally spoke to you. They explained the device was a microphone designed to pick up your voice so you could have a conversation. Apparently, when you never showed up to work they had been worried and sent someone looking for you. It seemed like your body had a reaction to the transformation causing the shrinking. They could work on looking for a way to reverse it if you didn't mind them running test on you, but there was always the risk of another reaction. An alternative, if you didn't want to risk shrinking further they mentioned having a new Jon your small stature would suit you for.
144122212211.title: Help From a Giant

choices: It works, you start to grow!
Something goes wrong and you shrink even smaller!
1441222122111.content:
More than anything else in the world you just want to be a normal sized person again, well normal sized lynx.

Whatever the experimental procedure is to fix this process you're willing to go through with it, because it's not like things can get much worse. The next several days that follow after this seem to last a lifetime as numerous test are done on you by the techs at MA Labs trying to find what caused you to shrink so small in the first place and how to fix it. Some of them are basic things such as measuring your height and weight, some were more tricky like trying to get a sample of your blood.

For that they had to actually shrink down one of their own agents to be no bigger than an insect just so they could get a decent look at you. it was unnerving to have this man who was no bigger than an insect pick you up and hold you in the palm of his hand as if you weighed nothing at all, and truthfully you weren't far off from weighing nothing. He used a very fine needle to poke one of your paws and drew a drop of blood that had to be examined under a microscope in studies. The same tech worked with you over several days. At first it was awkward working with the tiny giant. Like you he was completely naked after being shrunk, the technology they had currently only shrinking organic lifeforms. Unlike you though he had no fur to cover his body and it was just strange to look at the giant pink man that would come and scoop you up each day.

After several tests, and being poked, prodded, and at least at one point juggled, purely in the interest of scientific pursuit, they had a treatment plan. A serum specifically tailored to your body that should reverse the shrinking.

They placed you in a petri dish again and administered one drop of the serum next to you. It was just a single drop from an eye dropper but the tiny droplet was like an Olympic swimming pool to you. Relieved things were finally about to be over you waded into the liquid and waited for the results.
1441222122111.title: You want to try to reverse the shrinking

choices: You're given your first job in your new role.
You have a vacation day to explore your new home.
1441222122112.content:
As difficult as being smaller than a flea is you aren't quite ready to mess around with more mad science and risk even more complications, at least not without hearing the alternative. For now you decide to ask about this other job opportunity that they have.

It takes a bit of time for them to explain the entire thing, but it's pretty basic. Lots of people who have come to MA to act out their various fantasies have been shrunk to all sorts of sizes, many who even as nothing more than a barely visible speck you would tower over. This was something you were aware of, after all before this whole shrinking thing had happened you were originally supposed to play the part of one of the 'giant' animals the shrunken people could play with.

What it comes down too is as customers get exceptionally tiny it becomes very hard to keep track of them and actually retrieve them after the session is over. That would be where you come in. At your tiny size you'd be dropped into the fur of whatever animals the client was currently lost in to search for them. You'd be dropped around the genera area they were lost in, and it'd be your job to retrieve the other shrunken people and safely deliver them back into the care of the lab technicians. This of course meant that you wouldn't be returning to normal size ever if you accepted, at least not while still employed. In order to accurately search through the forest of fur that was going to be the larger animals you'd need to be as small as the clients.

It was also lucky you had also been transformed most of the way into an animal. Some clients were ornery and would have to be dragged back by force, since there was never any guarantee on if they were going to be bigger or smaller than you having a bit of extra feline muscle on you was a plus for the job. Plus, you were probably going to be doing a lot of climbing.

After listening to the details of the job it seemed like the best deal, it was something that needed to be done, and at your current size that was probably going to be about the only career option you actually had.

As part of your new job you were given a terrarium to use as your own personal residence. The thing was far larger than any house would have ever seened for a small glass box. They had given you small scraps of fabric to use for furniture and beds, but for entertainment purposes they didn't exactly have a TV or computer they could plug in and you actually use. Instead, most of the terrarium was covered in plants and vegetation, though you were the only animal in there. This was probably for the best since a single leaf was large enough for you to play a football game on.

Still on your time off it gave you something to do, things to explore and climb and it was a lot better than boredom. Food and water was provided for you as well, though they were just teeny pellets and droplets of water placed into your home with an eyedropper. Occasionally, small organisms such as dust ites would get in despite the lab's best efforts to keep your home quarantine, and you could amuse yourself hunting down and stalking the creatures. You weren't fond of the taste but it was something to let out your animal instincts.

It was... a very strange life.
1441222122112.title: You're more interested in this job

144122212212.content:
No, you won't be going back. That's the decision you come too. Being this small, it's not exactly an easy life, but you've proven you can survive over the weekend. Dust mites might not be the tastiest of meal, but it's something you can learn to live on, you don't trust the people from MA, you weren't supposed to shrink again, and who knows maybe this was something that was done on purpose, or maybe it was an accident, Rather it be spite or incompetence, you couldn't risk working with them again, who knows what would happen.

So, you had come to the conclusion to stay right where you were. You ran for one of the pillows on your bed, planning to climb into the actual pillow case. It took awhile to climb the side of it and swing yourself in but you were certain you wouldn't be found. Eventually, the man in the uniform walked over to your bed, examining the strands of fur, and then peering very closely at your bed and you guessed he had fund the much smaller strands of fur you had shed since shrinking, must have been good eyes.

He lifted up the pillow with you inside as you desperately tried to cling to the inside of it with your claws. He was looking under the pillow, and without even looking inside dropped it on the floor while he searched your bed. You were thrown around and felt your head spinning as you climbed back to your feet after the pillow hit the ground. Dizzily, you looked around while trying to keep your body low to the ground and stay hidden. Eventually the man shook his head and you heard him say something like

"Must have shrunken right out of existence, shoulda tested that formula more." He muttered this to himself as he turned and left your roo.

After you were certain he was gone you climbed out of the pillow case, stepping out between strands of carpet that were as tall as trees in comparison to you. You were alone now, and you'd be alone for the rest of your life, but somehow you knew you were going to be alright. Hidden down here amongst the carpet in a world others would never even know existed you would make a new home. These tree sized carpet strands were your jungle, and it was here you'd hunt, you'd survive, and you'd live out your life.

Years passed and you became an expert, there were more dust mites in a room than you could ever hope to count, prey was never short and most days you found yourself lazing around with a full belly just looking around seeing what you would find. On occasion, you found a rare treat, a crumb of food, which years ago you would have found the idea of tasting a treat but after years of dining on only dust mites, finding an old crumb of a stale cookie was like finding a pot of gold at the end of the rainbow, it was glorious.

Eventually, your home was sold, and other people moved in. The giants never became aware of your presence and you never paid them much heed. At this size you could hide between strands of carpets and never even had to worry about being stepped on. On occasion you'd climb to the top of a strand of carpet to look around and see what you could see. The giants looked so alien, having been a lynx for so long and no contact it felt weird to see humans again, and seeing them so large really made them look like some kind of monster or titans, but ones you had come to love. With the coming of these giants had come new sources of food, fresh crumbs small enough they never even noticed represented a feast to you. This made it where you had to spend less time hunting as you found food, and even gave you something to do, searching the forest of carpet for crumbs because like a treasure hunt, never knowing what you could find.

It was a simple life of simple pleasures, you took pride knowing you were able to survive while being so tiny, most people you imagined wouldn't have lasted, but for you, this was now your world, this was your jungle, and you were its king.
144122212212.title: Forest of Carpet

15.content: Female Employee Type Choice Top
15.title: What are you wearing?

151.content: You are a woman and you're an employee at MA. You don't know a lot about the company since you haven't been hee long enough. But you're determined to do as much of a good job like you've been doing. Before we continue what's your name
151.title: Woman

choices: No! I can't! I really have plans.
1511.content:
Alex sat back in her chair with a heavy thump. She looked at the clock as she ran her fingers through her long blond hair. Half an hour left to go, then a long three day weekend, she noted. A sigh of relief escaped her lips. Three long, long days of nothing to do. Turn off the phone, watch a movie or two, drink some wine, fix a nice dinner.

Her ruminations were interrupted by Natasha - a fellow co-worker - stopping by her cube. Unlike herself, employed in sales and booking, Natasha worked the floor as an Agent - whatever that was. First day on the job, she had backed straight into Natasha's car - a lovingly restored 1957 Chevy. The Chevy took no damage whatsoever while Lex's back bumper fell clean off. It was a start, as they say, of a beautiful friendship.

So, how did your first week go? She asked, leaning against the filing cabinet.

Lex spun in her chair. "Aside from Monday's little encounter, everything's been pretty smooth. The people are friendly, the money is good. The only thing is that I'm still getting used to things around here though." She reached over and picked up her coffee cup, taking a long draw before continuing. "Heck, I'm still not clear on what exactly we do here. It’s some kind of a travel agency, right?"

Tasha looked shocked. "What - you have no idea? You didn’t take the orientation?"

Lex waved dismissively. "The manager said that he was going to, but got caught up in a meeting or something. He never did get back around to it."

"So how have you been selling?"

"Oh, that’s easy - I just follow the script and plug the names and numbers into the database. They said they wanted discretion when they hired me, so I cant get much more discrete that this right?"

Natasha shook her head. "No, this wont do at all. Come with me," she said, grabbing her hand and yanking Lex from the chair.

"What? Where are we going?"

"You have plans this weekend?

"No, not really. Just a movie and. . ."

"Fine. You have plans now. I'm going to give you the trip of a lifetime. . . . ."
1511.title: Enter Natasha

1512.content:
Your name is Kelly Hayes. You were recently hired as a consultant and you have some expirence, if not all. Your twin sister, Elaine has moved with her modeling career and you're not going to let it damper your chances of working hard.

You worked so hard to finish college to not let anyone stand in between you and the road to success. However you were walking into to your office one day when you encounter a man around 6'2. Is he a man or something else
1512.title: Hi Kelly

152.title: Where'd the animal lady come from?

1521.content:
You come from a planet of animal people. Star Technologies was looking for people of your species to do some size-related... things. Immediately, you knew this was for you. It, well, clicked.
You took the first ship too earth.

When you entered the StarTech building the looks you got were promising. You have been asked to fill out a form.

Basic species type:
1521.title: Extraterrestrial

choices: Herbivore. (Could eat a little meat if you know what I mean)
15211.title: Mammal.

choices: Based on a smaller bird, like a Parrot
15212.title: Avian.

choices: Human mind put in new body
153.title: How'd a nice lady like you end up all metal?

154.content: How did your animal get sentient?
154.title: Not your average pets

info.brief_description: Making your little fantasy a reality. A Star Technologies Affiliate. Additions welcome.
info.description:
Welcome customer to Star Technologies, where our motto is, "Going where no one has ever dreamed of going before"

You have selected for your pleasure today a companionship service, Macrophiles Anonymous. This service uses a special formula developed by a scientist to miniaturize you, the customer so that you can live out a fantasy. Now your safety, and future business, is paramount to us so please remember to read the safety instructions and to please use the Tachyon Tag, otherwise known as the Second Chance Tag, before drinking the formula. This will allow you to survive anything by taking you back to the moment you used the tag the instant of your death through the use of a Quantum Waveform Effector. Now please check out our catalogs for the companion of your choice, be they man, woman, or animal, and then wait at the address you provide our service. We will send the companion along with the formula to this address, all of this being completely confidential. So sit back, relax, and realize that we at Star Tech have only the customer's best interests at heart.

::Rules::
For those of you wondering, no you don't have to add to the Macrophile Tell section if you don't want to, you can just add to the story, that's all right too or vise versa.
There are no restrictions or limits on what you can add in the story or Tell sections. I make no minimum length or type restrictions, as this is supposed to be a story for Macrophilia in general so there is nothing that you are not allowed to do. Please add wherever you like. Don't be afraid, and remember, if you add to me, I'll add to you.
